item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Dozens of Hezbollah members said to be seriously injured as devices explode (327 points | 267 comments)
2. Pixtral 12B (42 points | 5 comments)
3. "Four Seconds to Hot Up the Disintegrator, Google Had Told Me It Wasn't Enough" (166 points | 59 comments)
4. Things you should know about Windows Input, but would rather not (61 points | 32 comments)
5. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (32 points | 25 comments)
6. The Centrality of Stupidity in Mathematics (140 points | 69 comments)
7. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (92 points | 5 comments)
8. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (6 points | 1 comment)
9. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (50 points | 33 comments)
10. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (115 points | 18 comments)
11. Rio-labs/rio: WebApps in pure Python. No JavaScript, HTML and CSS needed (107 points | 86 comments)
12. Fixing an Elgato HD60 S HDMI capture device with the help of Ghidra (415 points | 78 comments)
13. Signatures of Gravitational Atoms from Black Hole Mergers (70 points | 22 comments)
14. Advice on Reading Homer in Translation (41 points | 17 comments)
15. A Curried Composition Puzzle (54 points | 6 comments)
16. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (52 points | 13 comments)
17. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (27 points | 9 comments)
18. Show HN: Waulog – A digital companion for dog owners (7 points | 6 comments)
19. An interactive core memory electronic kit (24 points | 1 comment)
20. Not a Normal Field Trip (4 points | discuss)
21. Show HN: Opik, an open source LLM evaluation framework (22 points | 4 comments)
22. IBM acquires Kubecost (21 points | 9 comments)
23. The Theft of a Priceless Churchill Portrait (34 points | 14 comments)
24. Show HN: Electrico – Electron Without Node and Chrome (Rust / Wry) (158 points | 64 comments)
25. Tiny Trackers Are Revealing the Secret Lives of Birds (31 points | 8 comments)
26. Chain of Thought empowers transformers to solve inherently serial problems (234 points | 152 comments)
27. Ncomm – A node-based robotics framework written in Rust (45 points | 21 comments)
28. Launch HN: Silurian (YC S24) – Simulate the Earth (315 points | 139 comments)
29. Can Generative Multi-Agents Spontaneously Form a Society? (20 points | 1 comment)
30. Ask HN: Is a Masters in CS/Engineering worth it for a mid-career PM? (53 points | 77 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
